sen.j: 椥辻駅（なぎつじえき）は、京都市山科区椥辻草海道町にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Nagitsuji Station is a railroad station on the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line, which is located in Nagitsuji Kusakaido-cho of the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City.
Nagitsuji Station, located in Nagitsuji Kusakaido-cho of the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, is a railroad facility on the Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line.
Nagitsuji Station, located in Nagitsuji Kusakaido-cho of the Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, is a railroad facility on the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line.

sen.j: 駅番号はT05。
sen.e: Its station number is T05.
Its station number is T05.
Its station number is T05.

sen.j: ホームは地下2層にあり、他の東西線の駅と同様、複線島式ホーム（1面2線）で、プラットホーム安全対策が設置されている。
sen.e: The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track, island platform (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers like platforms of other Tozai Line stations.
The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track island platform (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations.
The platform, located on the second basement level, is a double-track island platform (one platform for two lines) surrounded by safety barriers like the platforms of other Tozai Line stations.

sen.j: 東西線の駅は駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されているが、椥辻駅のステーションカラーは秋桜色。
sen.e: Each Tozai station is assigned a unique station color; the station color of Nagitsuji Station is bright pink.
Each Tozai station is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Nagitsuji Station is bright pink.
Each Tozai Line station is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Nagitsuji Station is bright pink.
sen.cmt: Tozai Line station としました。

sen.j: エレベーターは三菱製油圧式。
sen.e: Elevators at the station are hydraulic elevators made by Mitsubishi.
The station's elevators are hydraulic units manufactured by Mitsubishi.
The station's elevators are hydraulic units manufactured by Mitsubishi.

sen.j: 椥辻は山科区の中心地で、行政・文化・商業施設が集中しているとして駅の設置が決定された。
sen.e: Nagitsuji Station was built for Nagitsuji, which performs an important role in the Yamashina Ward as an area where administrative, cultural and commercial facilities are concentrated.
Nagitsuji Station was built for Nagitsuji, which performs an important role in the Yamashina Ward as an area where administrative, cultural and commercial facilities are concentrated.
Nagitsuji Station was built for Nagitsuji, which performs an important role in the Yamashina Ward as an area where administrative, cultural and commercial facilities are concentrated.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）7月31日 工事開始。
sen.e: The construction of the station was started on July 31, 1995.
The construction of the station commenced on July 31, 1995.
July 31, 1995: The construction of the station commenced.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）5月30日 完成。
sen.e: The construction was completed on May 30, 1997.
The process was completed on May 30, 1997.
May 30, 1997: The process was completed.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）10月12日 東西線醍醐～二条間営業開始により開業。
sen.e: The station opened on October 12, 1997, when the train service started in the Tozai Line section between Daigo Station and Nijo Station.
The station opened on October 12, 1997, when the service started in the Tozai Line section between Daigo and Nijo stations.
October 12, 1997: The station was opened and commensurate with the launch of service between Daigo Station and Nijo Station on the Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと表現を統一しました。日付表記変更

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards started to be used.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa cards came into use.

sen.j: 椥辻という地名は、かつてナギ（梛）の大木があったことに由来するという。
sen.e: It is believed that the place name, Nagitsuji, derives from a big nagi (Podcarpus nagi) tree that existed at the place.
It is believed that the place name, Nagitsuji, is derived from a large nagi (Podcarpus nagi) tree that existed at the place.
It is believed that the place name, Nagitsuji, is derived from a large nagi (Podcarpus nagi) tree that existed at the place.
sen.cmt: イタリックを削除しました。

sen.j: 名古屋市営地下鉄鶴舞線いりなか駅（地名は杁中）と同様に「椥」の字が常用漢字表にないことや読めない人が多いことから平仮名駅名も候補にあったようだが、漢字表記になった。
sen.e: Just as with Irinaka Station, a Nagoya City Subway Tsurumai Line station whose name contains a Chinese character not included among characters designated for common use in Japan, the name of Nagitsuji Station is difficult to read for many people if written in Chinese characters, and for this reason, it has been proposed to write the station name in hiragana, but after all, it was decided to use Chinese characters for the station name.

As with Irinaka Station, a Nagoya City Subway Tsurumai Line facility whose name contains a Chinese character not included among the characters designated for common use in Japan, the name of Nagitsuji Station is difficult to read for many people if written in Chinese characters, and for this reason it has been proposed to write the station name in hiragana; ultimately, however, it was decided to use Chinese characters for the station name.

As with Irinaka Station, a Nagoya City Subway Tsurumai Line facility whose name contains a Chinese character not included among the characters designated for common use in Japan, the name of Nagitsuji Station is difficult to read for many people if written in Chinese characters, and for this reason it had been proposed to write the station name in hiragana; ultimately, however, it was decided to use Chinese characters for the station name.
sen.cmt: has been →had been としました。

sen.j: 大阪市営地下鉄谷町線喜連瓜破駅などと同様に難読駅の部類にあたる地下鉄駅である。
sen.e: This station is therefore counted among subway stations whose names are the most difficult to read, along with stations such as Kire-Uriwari Station, which is on the Osaka City Subway Tanimachi Line.

This station is therefore counted among the subway stations whose names are the most difficult to read, along with stations such as Kire-Uriwari Station, which is on the Osaka City Subway Tanimachi Line.

This station is therefore counted among the subway stations whose names are the most difficult to read, along with stations such as Kire-Uriwari Station, which is on the Osaka Municipal Subway Tanimachi Line.
